title: Urgent: Your Package is On Hold
description: Received a text message claiming a package from a well-known delivery service is on hold. It asks me to click a link to reschedule delivery and pay a small 'redelivery fee.' The website it linked to looked very convincing, but the URL was slightly misspelled. I almost entered my credit card details.

title: Suspicious Account Activity - Action Required
description: An email pretending to be from my bank stated that there has been suspicious activity on my account. It urged me to log in via a provided link to verify my identity immediately or my account would be frozen. The sender's email address was slightly off, using '.co' instead of '.com'.

title: Exclusive Work-From-Home Job Opportunity
description: A LinkedIn message offered a high-paying remote data entry job. The 'recruiter' conducted a quick chat interview and then asked for my personal information and a fee for 'training materials' and a background check before any formal contract was signed. They insisted on payment via a peer-to-peer payment app.
warningSigns: Too good to be true offer

title: Guaranteed High Returns on Crypto Investment
description: An ad on social media promoted a new cryptocurrency with guaranteed 50% weekly returns. The platform required a minimum investment and showed fake profit gains, but withdrawals are impossible. They kept asking for more money to 'unlock' my funds, citing fake taxes and fees.

title: Warning: Your Computer is Infected!
description: A loud pop-up appeared on a website, claiming my computer was infected with multiple viruses. It provided a toll-free number to call for 'Microsoft Certified' tech support. They wanted remote access to my PC and tried to sell me a $500 'lifetime security plan'.

title: Netflix Subscription Problem
description: I got an email that looked exactly like it was from Netflix, saying my payment was declined and my subscription is canceled. It had a button to 'Restart Membership'. I clicked it and it took me to a page asking for my full credit card details and billing address. It was a phishing attempt to steal my financial info.

title: Romance Scam on Dating App
description: I was talking to someone on a dating app for weeks. They claimed to be working overseas and we developed a strong connection. Suddenly, they had a medical emergency and asked me for thousands of dollars to cover hospital bills, promising to pay me back as soon as they returned. It was all a lie.
warningSigns: Asks for money for an emergency

title: Fake 'Grandchild in Trouble' Call
description: Received a frantic call from someone pretending to be my grandson. He said he was arrested and needed bail money sent via a wire transfer immediately, and begged me not to tell his parents. I almost fell for it, but called my daughter first. My real grandson was safe at home.

title: Amazon 'Brushing' Scam
description: I've been receiving small, unordered packages from Amazon containing cheap items like phone cases and plastic toys. I learned this is a 'brushing' scam, where sellers create fake accounts in my name, send items, and then post fake positive reviews to boost their ratings. It's unsettling that they have my address.

title: Your Social Security Number is Suspended
description: An automated robocall claimed my Social Security Number has been suspended due to criminal activity. To reactivate it, I was instructed to press 1 and speak to an 'agent.' They then asked for my SSN to 'verify' my identity. This is a classic tactic to steal your identity.
